thumbnailÔÉÅ

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)

videocompletion_setÔÉÅ

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class videos_app.permissions.IsOwnerOrStaffÔÉÅ

Bases: BasePermission

Access is only allowed if the user is the owner or is a staff member. This includes checking for authentication.

class videos_app.serializers.VideoCompletionSerializer(*args, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Serializer for video completion.

class MetaÔÉÅ

Bases: object

fields = ['id', 'video_id', 'current_time', 'updated_at']ÔÉÅ
modelÔÉÅ

alias of VideoCompletion

create(validated_data)ÔÉÅ

We have a bit of extra checking around this in order to provide descriptive messages when something goes wrong, but this method is essentially just:

return ExampleModel.objects.create(**validated_data)

If there are many to many fields present on the instance then they cannot be set until the model is instantiated, in which case the implementation is like so:

example_relationship = validated_data.pop(‚Äòexample_relationship‚Äô) instance = ExampleModel.objects.create(**validated_data) instance.example_relationship = example_relationship return instance

The default implementation also does not handle nested relationships. If you want to support writable nested relationships you‚Äôll need to write an explicit .create() method.

update(instance, validated_data)ÔÉÅ

videos_app.signals moduleÔÉÅ

videos_app.signals.create_video(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Enqueues routine tasks upon video creation regarding the video duration and conversion to HLS format.

videos_app.signals.delete_video(sender, instance, *args, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Deletes associated video content files upon deletion of a video model instance.

videos_app.tasks moduleÔÉÅ

videos_app.tasks.convert_video_to_hls(video_obj)ÔÉÅ

Converts uploaded video file into HLS streaming format, covering the video resolutions and bitrates defined above.

videos_app.tasks.create_playlists(video_obj)ÔÉÅ

Creates multiple HLS playlist files and combines them into a single master playlist.

videos_app.tasks.set_video_duration(video_obj)ÔÉÅ

Sets duration of video instance after calculating the value.

test_get_video_completion_detail_different_user_not_found()ÔÉÅ

Tests video completions detail view GET request when the video completion object is not assigned to the active user.

Asserts:

  • 404 Not found status.

Tests video completions detail view GET request without credentials.

Asserts:

  • 401 Unauthorized status.

test_get_video_completion_detail_ok()ÔÉÅ

Tests video completions detail view GET request.

Asserts:

  • 200 OK status.

  • Absence of user field in response data.

  • Presence of all serializer fields in response data.

Tests video completions detail view PATCH request for a foreign completion.

test_post_video_completion_list_already_exists_ok()ÔÉÅ

Tests video completions list view POST request when there is already a video completion instance for this combination of user and video. (The existing instance will be updated rather than creating a new one.)

Asserts:

  • 200 Ok status.

  • Object user is request user.

  • Object id is existing id.

  • Current time has been updated.

  • Absence of user field in response data.

  • Presence of all serializer fields in response data.

test_post_video_completion_list_created()ÔÉÅ

Tests video completions list view POST request.

Asserts:

  • 201 Created status.

  • Object user is request user.

  • Absence of user field in response data.

  • Presence of all serializer fields in response data.

videos_app.utils.calc_duration(video_obj)ÔÉÅ

Calculates a video‚Äôs duration by running FFProbe and returning the program‚Äôs output.

videos_app.utils.delete_source_video(video_obj)ÔÉÅ

Deletes the source video upload associated with a video instance.

videos_app.utils.generate_calc_duration_cmd(video_obj)ÔÉÅ

Returns a command to calculate a video‚Äôs duration using FFProbe.

Returns a playlist basename designating the video instance and the vertical resolution.

videos_app.utils.generate_single_resolution_cmd(video_obj, index, resolution)ÔÉÅ

Returns a command to convert a video upload to a single selected resolution and bitrate.
